Description: Rim sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior glazed save for reserved lines at top and bottom of lip; exterior: black band on top part of rim, reserved below.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.8)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 240-1, no. 181)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 554-5, no. E21)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 21)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240. no. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.09) (Phase 1)
